decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).

Before the garage is converted to a habitable space, provision shall be made within the site for two car parking spaces as shown on the approved drawing 1924_PLN_06, which shall be constructed using porous material or provision shall be made to direct run-off water from the hard surface to a permeable or porous areas or surface within the curtilage of the property.  Thereafter this provision shall be made permanently available for use, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
To ensure that adequate car parking provision is made off street in the interests of highway safety.
All new external finishes shall be carried out in materials to match those of the existing building(s) to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area, and in order that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).

The Local Planning Authority consider it essential that the whole of the development is carried out and that no departure whatsoever is made from the details approved, since the development would not necessarily be acceptable if partly carried out or carried out differently in any degree from the details submitted.  Also, in order that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

Notwithstanding the drawings hereby approved, the application only grants planning permission for the garage conversion as indicated on the approved plans, and does not grant de facto permission or indicate the lawfulness of any other development on the site.
To protect the ability of the Council to take enforcement action if it is found that other extensions are unlawful for any reason, it is necessary and expedient to impose such a planning informative.

Statement Required by Article 31 (cc) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management) Order 2010: No significant problems were identified during the consideration of the application, and therefore it has been determined in accordance with paragraphs 186-187 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2012.
description: Conversion of garage to habitable use, involving alterations to front elevation and addition of parking space to front of house
